intro: Chrysophyllum lanceolatum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when they turn yellow or orange. Its botanical features include a smooth, greyish-bark and a tendency to grow in moist, well-drained soils. The tree is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit production.
